results.title: Nightmail
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Basil Wright, John Grierson and GPO Film Unit
results.brief_description: Classic British documentary recounting the journey of the ‘Postal Special’ train from London to Glasgow. Carrying no passengers, the postal staff sort mail on board and receive and despatch mailbags ‘en route’. The non professional cast performed scripted scenes, giving a human dimension to the mechanics of mail delivery. Along with a dry factual voice-over, the soundtrack offered music by composer Benjamin Britten and verse by W.H. Auden.

results.title: Nightlife
results.brief_description: Robin Lehman explores the wonders of the cold seas of Ireland. Shows the many creatures and plants, including scallops, sea anemone, fan worm and jellyfish. This fantastic drama captures some of nature’s most amazing and improbable creations. Without words but accompanied by music and sound effects.

results.title: Nighthawks. What can I do with a male nude?
results.creator_credit: Paul Hallam, Ron Peck, Nighthawks and Four Corner Films
results.brief_description: ‘Nighthawks’ pictures the everyday experiences of a homosexual schoolteacher in a film which is both a subjective account of the teacher’s disjointed emotional life, and a record of the gay scene in London towards the end of the 1970’s. ‘What can I do with a male nude?’ is a witty short film showing the point of view of a gay photographer as he photographs a muscular male model.

results.title: Night train [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: John Lynch, Tristan Orpen Lynch, Coachouse Productions and Subotica Films
results.brief_description: Night train is a romantic drama by first time director John Lynch featuring Oscar nominees John Hurt (Elephant Man, 1984) as Michael Poole, an ex-con man, and Brenda Blethyn (Secrets and Lies, Saving Grace) as Alice, the landlady’s daughter. Upon release from prison, Michael Poole seeks refuge in an effort to avoid pursuit by a sinister gangland boss to whom he owes money. He moves into a house owned by an elderly domineering mother (Pauline Flanagan) and her emotionally repressed daughter, Alice. Poole finds his passion for electric model trains has Alice intrigued and together they find escape in his strange fantasy world. An awkward and tender romance begins to develop between these two rather sad and lonely people, frustrated by their pasts, and determined to find happiness in their future. But Poole is forced to take flight as the mob boss closes in, and with him Alice, on a real night train adventure on the Orient Express. Set in Dublin and filmed on location in Ireland, England and Italy, “Night train” has many delightful and touching moments performed by two great actors and a very capable supporting cast. Cast also includes Lorcan Cranitch, Cathy White, Peter Caffrey, Paul Roe and Rynagh O’Grady. (Awards: Winner Silver Rose Best Actor John Hurt, Schermi d’Amore Verona; Nominated Best European Film John Lynch, Brussels International Film Festival)

results.title: Night sun = Il sole anche di notte
results.creator_credit: Vittorio Taviani, Paolo Taviani, Guiliani de Negri and Filmtre
results.brief_description: Based on Tolstoy’s short story “Father Sergius”, the Taviani brother’s “Night Sun” is a brooding portrait of one man’s search for truth. Baron Sergio Giuramondo (Julian Sands)is set for a comfortable life in the kings court when he discovers that the woman he is about to marry is the king’s mistress. He joins the priesthood, eventually becoming a monk with a growing reputation for saintliness. “Night Sun” is a beautiful film to watch, with plenty of lush italian palazzi settings and rural vistas of. Julian Sands is mesmerising as the tortured Father Sergius. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Night people's day
results.brief_description: Explores the city at night with emphasis on people who work at night and their occupations. The soundtrack recreates, with human voices and sound effects, the variety of sounds of the city and its activities. Night people tell why they prefer to work at night. Photography by Bob Hillman. Vocal sound effects by Bob Kurtz and Glenn Johnson.

results.title: Night Out
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Johnston, Lisa Doherty and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A young man is savagely bashed when he visits a toilet beat for sex. The assault forces a reassessment of the relationship he has with his boyfriend, as well as resulting in a self-examination of his own needs and desires. “Night out” is an intense Australian short that is as much about the intricacies and uncertainties of contemporary sexual relationships as it is about the violation and humiliation of physical assault. Official entry in the “Un Certain Regard” section of the 1990 Cannes Film Festival.

results.title: Night on earth
results.brief_description: This film by the talented independent director, Jim Jarmusch, is a collection of five vignettes each taking place in the confines of a taxi ride. Covering one night on earth, the stories occur simultaneously in five different cities and five different time zones: Los Angeles, New York City, Paris, London and Helsinki. Highlights include Roberto Benigni as the Roman taxi driver who recounts his past sexual exploits to a priest who is dying of a heart-attack in the back seat. In the New York scene a novice East German taxi driver (Armin Mueller-Stahl) has trouble with the foot pedals and his passenger ends up driving himself to Brooklyn. Cast includes Gena Rowlands, Rosie Perez, Giancarlo Esposito, Winona Ryder, Beatrice Dalle.
